notesStmt.note: Leaves missing after folios 2, 9, 121, 167. Well-fingered, with dirt and grease in margins, especially lower corner – a few of the latter have been infilled. A few tidemarks at head. Paper slightly soft and weak from use. Folio 168 has small loss at foredge.

A record of deposition of the manuscript, which was transferred from Yehudah ῾Amar (?) to Yaakov ibn Daud Yosef, dated 2026 (1715), witnessed by Shemarya ben Yosef and Mosheh ibn Se῾adyah: inscribed in Arabic (in Hebrew characters), folio 20v.An entry with a list of purchased books, dated 1866: folio 168v, in Arabic (in Hebrew characters).
Manuscript description based on Margoliouth, G.: Catalogue of the Hebrew and Samaritan Manuscripts in the British Museum, London 1965.

scriptDesc.scriptNote: Yemenite semi-cursive script of the second half of the 17th century. Shemarya ben Yosef ben Shalom: inscribed, folio 166v (acrostic in the upper part of the page).
